name: Yinsh
premise: Players compete to form lines of five markers of their own color.
description: YINSH is a game of abstract strategy from the GIPF project. Players alternate turns placing rings on the board and moving them to leave markers behind.
immersiveness_level_notes: The game's strategic depth can be highly engaging.
learning_curve_notes: The rules are easy to learn, but there are many strategic possibilities.
save_mechanism_notes: Games are usually played in one session.
how_to_win: Be the first to form five lines of five markers of your own color.
how_to_lose: Failing to form the necessary lines before your opponent.

reasons: Yinsh is a strategic game that requires careful planning.

unique_selling_point: Yinsh's simplicity and depth of strategy make it stand out among abstract strategy games.
